org.seedstack.business.domain

Class BaseRepository<A extends AggregateRoot<I>,I>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.seedstack.business.domain.BaseRepository<A,I>
  • Type Parameters:
    A - Type of the aggregate root.
    I - Type of the aggregate root identifier.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Repository<A,I>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BaseInMemoryRepository, BaseJpaRepository, BaseMorphiaRepository

    public abstract class BaseRepository<A extends AggregateRoot<I>,I>
extends Object
implements Repository<A,I>
    An helper base class that can be extended to create an implementation of a repository interface which, in turn, must extend Repository.

    This class is mainly used as a common base for specialized technology-specific implementations. Client code will often extend these more specialized classes instead of this one.

    See Also:
    Repository, BaseInMemoryRepository

    • Constructor Detail

      • BaseRepository

        protected BaseRepository()
        Creates a base domain repository. Actual classes managed by the repository are determined by reflection.

      • BaseRepository

        protected BaseRepository(Class<A> aggregateRootClass,
                         Class<I> idClass)
        Creates a base domain repository. Actual classes managed by the repository are specified explicitly. This can be used to create a dynamic implementation of a repository.
        Parameters:
        aggregateRootClass - the aggregate root class.
        idClass - the aggregate root identifier class.
